item.title: GERMANY TILTS LEFT: THE MAN ON TRACK TO REPLACE MERKEL...
item.description:
www.msn.com
Olaf Scholz of the Social Democrats has inched ahead of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservatives and claimed a mandate to lead the country’s next government in an unprecedentedly tight election to decide who will lead Europe’s biggest economy.

item.title: Supreme Court observers see trouble ahead as public approval of justices erodes...
item.description:
www.msn.com
With the court about to open one of its potentially most divisive terms in years, a debate rages over whether the nine justices are too political — and too powerful.

item.title: DEMS ON THE ROPES?
item.description:
www.msn.com
While many Democrats believe that in the end, party leaders will find a way to pass their ambitious plan, some have started contemplating a nightmare scenario, in which the talks fall apart and Democrats are left explaining to voters who gave them the keys to the car why they couldn’t get it out of neutral.

item.title: 'X Date'...

Administration officials rule out more heterodox ideas, such as minting $1 trillion coin, to resolve debt ceiling impasse

item.title: MORE HAITIANS WORKING WAY TO BORDER...
item.description:
www.reuters.com
Up to 4,000 migrants, most of them Haitians, have passed through the treacherous jungles of the Darien Gap in Panama on the Colombian border as they make their way north to the United States, two Panamanian government sources said.

item.title: WHO WILL REPLACE?
item.description:
apnews.com
BERLIN (AP) — Germany's center-left Social Democrats were locked in a very close race Sunday with outgoing German Chancellor Angela Merkel’s center-right bloc, which was heading toward its worst-ever result in the country's parliamentary election, projections showed.

item.title: 'GORY' SCENE...
item.description:
apnews.com
JOPLIN, Mont. (AP) — Federal officials sent a team of investigators from the National Transportation Safety Board to the site of an Amtrak derailment in north-central Montana that killed three people and left seven hospitalized Sunday, officials said.

item.title: Romans say enough to invasion of wild boars...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
Rome has been invaded by Gauls, Visigoths and vandals over the centuries, but the Eternal City is now grappling with a rampaging force of an entirely different sort: rubbish-seeking wild boars. Entire families of wild boars have become a daily sight in Rome, as groups of 10-30 beasts young and old emerge from the vast parks surrounding the city to trot down traffic-clogged streets in search of food in Rome’s notoriously overflowing rubbish bins. Posting wild boar videos on social media has become something of a sport as exasperated Romans capture the scavengers marching past their stores, strollers or playgrounds.

item.title: Inside CIA's secret war plans against WIKILEAKS...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
In 2017, as Julian Assange began his fifth year holed up in Ecuador’s embassy in London, the CIA plotted to kidnap the WikiLeaks founder, spurring heated debate among Trump administration officials over the legality and practicality of such an operation.

item.title: Tiny Rocket Ship-Like 'Micro-Robots To Deliver Drugs Inside Humans...
item.description:
www.studyfinds.org
Using a design inspired by bacteria and sperm, the micro-robots can be moved through the body using ultrasound to help deliver drugs to specific areas.

As the former CEO of the blood-testing company Theranos faces fraud charges, some are asking why other tech leaders accused of wrongdoing have avoided criminal charges.

item.title: NYC Busts Illicit Vans Used for AIRBNBs...
item.description:
www.nbcnewyork.com
Authorities in Manhattan impounded seven van over the course of two days they say were illegally registered and used as Airbnb rentals on city streets. Coined “operation room service,” deputies from the sheriff’s office, in partnership with the NYPD, busted more than half a dozen vehicles Thursday and Friday. Sheriff Joseph Fucito told NBC New York that investigators discovered the…

item.title: Kamala Harris, assigned to tackle volatile issues, quietly builds network...
item.description:

item.title: She bought dream home; 'Sovereign citizen' changed locks...

item.title: Crypto-Trading Hamster Performs Better Than Buffett, S&P 500...
item.description:
www.npr.org
A hamster named Mr. Goxx enters one of two tunnels in the his cage, which determines whether he will buy or sell. As of Friday, his portfolio is up nearly 20%, according to his Twitter account.

item.title: 3 DEAD; 'WELL OVER' 50 HURT...

item.title: TRAVEL HELL: UNITED fined for keeping thousands of passengers trapped on planes -- for hours...
item.description:
www.msn.com
The Transportation Department fined United Airlines $1.9 million for keeping thousands of passengers stuck on planes for hours. The airline said it has made investments to avoid lengthy delays.

item.title: 'Crews try to rescue passengers trapped inside'...
item.description:

item.title: DRUG COMPANIES CASH IN ON 'BOOSTERS'
item.description:
apnews.com
Billions more in profits are at stake for some vaccine makers as the U.S. moves toward dispensing COVID-19 booster shots to shore up Americans' protection against the virus. How much the manufacturers stand to gain depends on how big the rollout proves to be.
